newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products stand ground except easing fuel.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products stand ground except easing fuel.

text.p: NWE oil products were steady on Tuesday, except easier fuel, traders said.
Naphtha was steady. Traders said buyers and sellers remained at a stand-off but sellers were beginning to gain the upper hand over relaxed buyers with further arbitrage options East seen.
Gasoline was steady to firmer but trade was thin with good ARA supplies and flat U.S. gasoline markets capping gains.

Fuel oil weakened with supply good and the market in pre-Easter doldrums. Fob high sulphur barges traded at $85, while cargoes slipped to $81-$83 fob NWE. Low sulphur cargoes were off $1 at $94/$96 fob.
Gas oil premiums were weakened amid sluggish trade, but the drop was sweetened by stronger IPE gas oil futures.
